scene.name: intro
scene.option: One, but it went under a rock.

scene.name: questions
scene.option: Why do you dress like a punk?

scene.name: dress
scene.line: A punk! Ha ha. Now what's a `punk` dress like, kid? Can you tell me?

scene.name: family
scene.line: Well, I've got Johnny. `The `. I've got you folks right now. Is that a family?
Let's call it what it is. Junebug and the people she surrounds herself with. See? It means something. It makes a claim. It's specific.

scene.name: boyfriend
scene.line: Naw — what's a `boyfriend`, anyway? It's a word people use because everyone else does. Doesn't mean anything to me. He's my cricket.
See? It means something. It's specific.

scene.name: be-specific
scene.line: I think you are. It's the middle of the night, and here you are in a graveyard. Any other kid your age would be in bed.

scene.name: junebug-bio
scene.line: You've just got to make choices and own them. You think I was born this foxy? I came off the assembly line about a half-foot shorter, and all gray. No eyes.

They were going to have us clearing out the old mine. Doesn't matter what you look like under all that rock and water: a bunch of gray shadows shoveling and hammering invisibly at the walls, draining the tunnels.
Johnny found some gear — an old tape player. We hid away in an underwater cave and listened to it over and over, and we knew we weren't miners ...
We slipped out onto the road, just these two featureless shadows, and ever since that night we've been detailing. Coloring in. Specifying.
I feel more like myself every day.
scene.option: I feel less like myself, without my folks.
I feel more like myself when it's just me and Julian.
I think I should be a musician, too.

scene.name: ezra-miss-family
scene.line: Sure. Some people are born into a family. Nothing wrong with that.

scene.name: ezra-julian
scene.line: Well, there — now you're getting specific.

scene.name: ezra-musician
scene.line: Is that right? I'll have to keep an eye on you.
